title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 166-3.10 - Correction or amendment of records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 166-3.10 - Correction or amendment of records

State Regulations
(a) Within 30
days of receipt by the division of a request for correction or amendment of a
record or personal information, the personal privacy protection officer shall
either: (1)
make the correction or amendment
in whole or in part, and notify the data subject that upon his or her request
such correction or amendment will be provided to any or all persons or
governmental units to which the record or personal information has been
disclosed; or
(2)
refuse to correct
or amend the record, notify the data subject of the reasons therefor, and
inform the data subject of the procedures to obtain review of such
determination by the general counsel's office. (b) Nothing in this section shall impair any
right of any division employee under a current collective bargaining
agreement. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
166-3.10

Amended

New

York State Register December 23, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 51, eff. 12/23/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
